body:
Comment 6: 
> ... But what's also true, is that on Windows there are other cases of using
%somestring% elements in environment variable values. ...

I checked my 2 computers (used [set | find "%"] command) Win XP and Windows 7. No
environment variables that have % symbol in its value. But, perhaps, some other people
do have these.

> ... Of course Windows itself knows how to handle those. ...

You are bit general here. What does "Windows" means in your statement. Feel free to
provide some references to that fact.

> ... But I'm sure a bunch of other programs do too. ...

Perhaps. Perhaps not.

> ... But apparently not all of them, and neither does Go.

Correct. Go authors try to keep things simple. If you want to use value of GOROOT
environment variable to build your GOBIN variable by using %GOROOT% in your batch file,
that is up to you. Go command does not need to know about Windows command language.

> ... now ... I know the cause, and how to avoid it. Thanks for helping out on this.

You are welcome.

Alex
_Status changed to **WorkingAsIntended**._
